SEARCH
Module com.example.flashcardai
Package db.DAO

Class StudyMetricsDAO

java.lang.Object
db.DAO.StudyMetricsDAO
public class StudyMetricsDAO extends Object
Data Access Object for managing study metrics related to flashcard reviews. Tracks user performance on each flashcard and supports spaced repetition strategies.

This class supports recording review attempts, identifying difficult cards, and resetting all metrics for a given user. It aligns with spaced repetition functionality described in the project’s user stories.

  • Constructor Details

    • StudyMetricsDAO

      public StudyMetricsDAO()

  • Method Details

    • recordReview

      public static boolean recordReview(int userId, int flashcardId, String result)
      Records a user's review result for a specific flashcard. If the record exists, it updates it; otherwise, it inserts a new entry.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user
      flashcardId - the ID of the reviewed flashcard
      result - the result of the review ("easy", "hard", or "incorrect")
      Returns:
      true if the operation was successful; false otherwise
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if result is not one of the allowed values

    • getChallengingCardIds

      public static List<Integer> getChallengingCardIds(int userId, int limit)
      Retrieves a list of flashcard IDs that the user has most difficulty with. The difficulty score is calculated as: (hard + 2 × incorrect) / total attempts.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user
      limit - the maximum number of flashcard IDs to return
      Returns:
      a list of flashcard IDs sorted by difficulty score (descending)

    • resetMetricsForUser

      public static boolean resetMetricsForUser(int userId)
      Deletes all study metrics for a given user, effectively resetting their learning history. This supports the user story: “I want a way to reset my metrics so I can start fresh.”
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user whose metrics are to be cleared
      Returns:
      true if the reset operation was successful; false otherwise
